subject: Real Estate
title: Who Got Punished After 2008
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Who Got Punished After 2008.

hook.text: The 2008 crash destroyed $7 trillion in household wealth. Exactly one Wall Street banker went to prison.

buildup.text: Banks paid $150 billion in fines. The cost was treated as a business expense, not a punishment.

discovery.text: Meanwhile, homeowners who lost their homes had their credit scores ruined for seven years.

twist.text: The banks that caused the crisis received $700 billion in taxpayer bailouts and recovered within five years.

climax.text: The asymmetry of consequences â€” bailouts for banks, ruin for families â€” defined a generation's distrust.

punchline.text: Banks got bailouts. Families got blame.
